name: KellyKapowski
author: ANTs Developers
description: DiReCT is a registration based estimate of cortical thickness. It was published in S. R. Das, B. B. Avants, M. Grossman, and J. C. Gee, Registration based cortical thickness measurement, Neuroimage 2009, 45:867--879.

inputs.name: Image dimensionality
inputs.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, DiReCT tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Segmentation image
inputs.description: A segmentation image must be supplied labeling the gray and white matters. Default values = 2 and 3, respectively.

inputs.name: Gray matter probability image
inputs.description: In addition to the segmentation image, a gray matter probability image can be used. If no such image is supplied, one is created using the segmentation image and a variance of 1.0 mm.

inputs.name: White matter probability image
inputs.description: In addition to the segmentation image, a white matter probability image can be used. If no such image is supplied, one is created using the segmentation image and a variance of 1.0 mm.

inputs.name: Convergence
inputs.description: Convergence is determined by fitting a line to the normalized energy profile of the last N iterations (where N is specified by the window size) and determining the slope which is then compared with the convergence threshold.

inputs.name: Thickness prior estimate
inputs.description: Provides a prior constraint on the final thickness measurement. Default = 10 mm.

inputs.name: Thickness prior image
inputs.description: An image containing spatially varying prior thickness values.

inputs.name: Gradient step
inputs.description: Gradient step size for the optimization. Default = 0.025.

inputs.name: Smoothing variance
inputs.description: Defines the Gaussian smoothing of the hit and total images. Default = 1.0 mm.

inputs.name: Smoothing velocity field parameter
inputs.description: Defines the Gaussian smoothing of the velocity field (default = 1.5 voxels). If the b-spline smoothing option is chosen, then this defines the isotropic mesh spacing for the smoothing spline (default = 15 mm).

inputs.name: Use B-spline smoothing
inputs.description: Sets the option for B-spline smoothing of the velocity field. Default = false.

inputs.name: Use masked smoothing
inputs.description: Sets the option for masked-based smoothing of the velocity field. Default = false.

inputs.name: Time points
inputs.description: Time points for irregularly spaced time samples and time-variance with which to compute distance metric.

inputs.name: Restrict deformation
inputs.description: Restrict the last dimension's deformation. Meant for use with multiple time points. Default = false.

inputs.name: Number of integration points
inputs.description: Number of compositions of the diffeomorphism per iteration. Default = 10.

inputs.name: Maximum number of invert displacement field iterations
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations for estimating the invert displacement field. Default = 20.

inputs.name: Output
inputs.description: The output consists of a thickness map defined in the segmented gray matter.

output-files.name: Thickness map
output-files.description: The output is the thickness map defined in the segmented gray matter.
